column4: HELP! what bootloader will allow me to type something simple like "boot into dapper drake"?   i do a lot on my pc from work, so i'd like to be able to reboot into my other distros i have installed if possible.
I don't think I understand your question. Most bootloaders, lilo, grub, should do that.
Wouldn't it be the same as booting into windows or linux? Am I missing something?

i have 3 separate ubuntu partitions.  one is my primary, one is my testing (so i don't break the primary haha) and one is dapper drake to check it out.    i have to modify /boot/grub/menu.lst and change the default partition to boot into while i'm SSH'd into my box from away
all of my partitions have SSH installed, and i'd like to be able to do work on all of them while away.
You like to make life hard for yourself. :)
i am trying to get E17 working, so i am doing it on my testing ubuntu before i do it live.   i've had to re-install ubuntu 3 times within a week because i effed up E17 everytime.

so because of this, i'd like to figure out how to do "reboot into Testuntu" (what i called testing)          i know SUSE has something similar from what i've heard . . .  PC-BSD has a grpahical interface at the login screen that lets you reboot into a different partition without going through the bootloader.
so basically i'm trying to make my life easier. =)
Perhaps you could write a script do quickly swap menu.lst files and install.
i don't know how. =)    could you direct me where i can learn about writing scripts?
Sorry, I don't know of a pre-packaged solution for this.
that's fine.  i want to learn how to do it. =)
You can basically make a script just by putting the same commands you type at the command prompt into a file.
Then make the file executable. chmod +x myfile
I would try something like making menu.lst a soft link.
